Description: Mudstone (greywacke) palette carved in the shape of a fish with a small upturned nose with mouth defined by short incision, drilled eye, short incised lines all along top of body and in three groups along bottom edge; small tail carved free from body, lost. Single piercing at top.
Curator's comments: Palette type like 38H in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery and Palettes (1921).
